snippet: As president of the Southern University and A&M College System in Louisiana, Ms. Spikes opposed court-ordered desegregation of the state’s colleges to protect Southern’s identity as a black institution.
abstract: Dolores Spikes, who was appointed president of Southern University and A&M College System in Louisiana in 1988, making her the first woman to head a university system in the United States, dies at age 78.
lead_paragraph: As president of the Southern University and A&M College System in Louisiana, Ms. Spikes opposed court-ordered desegregation of the state’s colleges to protect Southern’s identity as a black institution.

headline.main: Dolores Spikes, Trailblazer as President of Southern University, Dies at 78
headline.print_headline: Dolores Spikes, 78, a Trailblazing University President

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Southern University and Agricultural & Mechanical College
